name: L1Z1X Mindnet
summary: cybernetic-organic hybrids

name: Lagomorphic Humanoids
summary: Rabbit-like humanoids: Y5, Y5’ Dad and KS-2

name: Lavos
summary: planetary parasite

name: Laxidasians
summary: humanoid

name: Lectroids
source: The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the Eighth Dimension

name: Leerans
summary: A yellow amphibian species with tentacles for arms that resembles a manta ray or frog. They live in the vast oceans on their homeworld, Leera, which has only one small continent of land (originally, Leerans needed to go on land to mate, but technology has made that unnecessary). Leerans have advanced psychic powers, which make them very desirable Yeerk hosts.

name: Leoniders
summary: humanoid

name: Lepidopterran
summary: Lepidopterrans come in two variations depending on the series. In the Original series, they resemble a combination of dragonflies, hornets, and butterflies, and are equipped with sharp stingers on their tails and four penduculated eyes on the sides of their heads. In the reboot, however, they more closely resemble humanoid dragonflies, complete with antenna and compound eyes. Both versions can spray foul smelling slime and fly at high speeds, but are frail and not particularly strong.

name: Leviathan
summary: bio-mechanoid (artificially engineered, living sentient spaceship. Capable of natural procreation)

name: Life Fibers
summary: Thread-like creatures that can be merged with either clothing or human beings. Appear to be a hostile hive-mind with the ulterior motive of planetary destruction.

name: Limax
summary: Gelatinous, shapeshifting creatures who are carnivorous in nature, more specifically preying on elderly humans. They are fond of high levels of heat, but are weak to and afraid of water.

name: Lithians
source: James Blish's A Case of Conscience

name: Llorn
summary: Neckless bipeds who veil themselves and their spacecraft in shadow. Soft-spoken but powerful. Feared on the planet Ryn, whose empire they destroyed 30 thousand years ago.

name: Loboan
summary: Aliens resembling werewolves hailing from the moon Luna Lobo, they are very vicious hunters. Alongside enhanced strength, speed, hearing, and agility, they can see in the dark and unleash powerful sonic howls.

name: Locust
summary: aliens that originate from beneath the surface of the Earth.  Intent on destroying humanity.

name: Logrians
source: The History of the Galaxy series

name: Loomi
summary: creatures inhabiting Jupiter with heat-retaining skins

name: Loric
summary: A peaceful race from the planet Lorien, who were almost wiped out by another alien race, the Mogadorians. They currently reside on Earth.

name: Lorwardians
summary: humanoid

name: Lumas
source: Super Mario Galaxy, Super Mario Galaxy 2

name: Luminoth
summary: peaceful race that worships "Light of Aether."  Fight against Ing for control of homeworld.  Only a single Luminoth is ever encountered, known as U-Mos.

name: Lunarians
summary: (月の民, Tsuki no tami?, lit. "Moon People"); light-haired humanoid beings from the Moon.

name: Lunarian
summary: humanoid alien race that lives on the Earth's moon. Notable members of the race would be Kaguya Houraisan and Eirin Yagokoro.

name: Lurmans
summary: Humanoid

name: Luxans
summary: humanoid
